original: I haven't received any answer yet.
translated: Je n'ai toujours pas eu de réponse.

original: I worked as hard as I could so I didn't fail.
translated: J'ai travaillé aussi dur que j'ai pu de manière à ne pas échouer.

original: I sent a message to Tom.

original: This is my favorite track on the entire disc.
translated: De tout le disque, c'est ma piste préférée.

original: I have never stopped loving you.
translated: Je n'ai jamais cessé de t'aimer.

original: The choice is all up to you.
translated: Le choix repose entièrement entre tes mains.

original: In the attic, there was a round table.
translated: Dans le grenier, il y avait une table ronde.

original: My son is taller than me.

original: Don't judge others by the colour of their skin.

original: I'll contact you when I can.

original: He did not enjoy his lessons.

original: He has to speak English.
translated: Il doit parler anglais.

original: Where's the admission's office?

original: She read books all night.
translated: Elle lit des livres toute la nuit.

original: I took that picture a week ago.
translated: J'ai pris cette photo il y a une semaine.

original: He is a learned man.

original: I haven't seen this movie before.
translated: Je n'ai jamais vu ce film auparavant.

original: Melancholy feeds madness.

original: Potatoes give me wind.
translated: Manger des pommes de terre me fait péter.

original: Is that significant?

original: I'm not sure I can trust her.
translated: Je ne suis pas sûre que je puisse me fier à elle.

original: Strange things happened in that house.
translated: Des choses étranges ont eu lieu dans cette maison.

original: The evidence is overwhelming.

original: Everyone was hurt.

original: He developed his own theory.
translated: Il a développé sa propre théorie.

original: They deserve respect.
translated: Ils méritent le respect.

original: I've warned you before about this.

original: He was curious to see the inside.
translated: Il était curieux de voir à l'intérieur.

original: Darn it!

original: I could not but sigh when I heard the news.

original: I play a lot with my cousins, nieces and nephews.
translated: Je joue beaucoup avec mes cousins, nièces et neveux.

original: The Supreme Court overturned a previous decision.
translated: La Cour suprême a cassé un arrêt précédent.

original: He seems to be afraid of being laughed at if he makes a mistake.
translated: Il semble avoir peur d'être ridiculisé s'il commet une erreur.

original: Is this some kind of joke?

original: Studying how to communicate effectively is time well spent.
translated: Étudier comment communiquer de manière efficace est du temps bien dépensé.

original: I never noticed.

original: Nicole can speak Japanese very well.
translated: Nicole sait très bien parler japonais.

original: I may try again later.
translated: Il se peut que j'essaye à nouveau plus tard.

original: She clasped my hands and said she was glad to see me.
translated: Elle m'a saisi les mains et m'a dit qu'elle était heureuse de me voir.

original: My job is to anticipate problems.

original: Tomorrow is Mother's Day.
translated: Demain, c'est la fête des mères.

original: Both Tom and Mary know that isn't true.

original: Can you go faster?

original: She obviously loves you.

original: I followed you.

original: That isn't nice.

original: All wise men are good, but not all good men are wise.

original: Sami's fingerprints didn't match the killer.
translated: Les empreintes digitales de Sami ne correspondaient pas à celles du tueur.

original: Find your strength in the silence.

original: Jean and Philippe are going to take a look.

original: We already sang that song.

original: "You're a good guitarist." "I'd like to think I am."

original: Give Tom everything you have.
translated: Donnez à Tom tout ce que vous avez.

original: "If you trip, you'll fall down. And if you fall down, that will be your downfall", said Arnaud Vannay.

original: I'm tired of doing this.

original: The decision has something to do with what you said.

original: His life is a neverending race against time.
translated: Sa vie est une course contre-la-montre permanente.

original: It is a very sad tale.
translated: C'est une histoire très triste.

original: Tom and Mary both know that that's not true.
translated: Tom et Mary savent tous deux que ce n'est pas vrai.

original: I think we can trust him.
translated: Je pense que nous pouvons nous fier à lui.

original: I want to become a doctor.
translated: Je veux devenir médecin.

original: I can't decide what to order.

original: The boy fell off the bicycle and fractured his skull.
translated: Le garçon est tombé du vélo et s'est fait une fracture du crâne.

original: This will do for the time being.

original: He's out at the moment.

original: If you don't want your sentences being commented on, just don't write them!

original: Don't tell me you can't read.
translated: Ne me dites pas que vous ne savez pas lire !

original: Tom and Mary have only two children.
translated: Tom et Marie ont seulement deux enfants.

original: Set him free.

original: His only wish was to see his son again one more time.

original: How's your old lady doing?

original: He is no longer a boy.

original: Visiting hours are almost over.
translated: Les heures de visite sont presque terminées.

original: What's your favorite hobby?

original: Tom is an adult now.
translated: Tom est un adulte désormais.

original: I can help you do that right now.

original: You're supposed to help your friends when they're in trouble.
translated: Tu es supposée aider tes amis lorsqu'ils ont des ennuis.

original: It has a flaw.

original: Your parents can't keep us apart forever.

original: There are about seventy hens in the henhouse, but only one rooster.
translated: Il y a environ soixante-dix poules dans le poulailler, mais un seul coq.

original: Tell me why I should do that.
translated: Dis-moi pourquoi je devrais faire ça.

original: I could keep it a secret.

original: He lives somewhere around here.
translated: Il vit quelque part près d'ici.

original: Please feel free to make suggestions.
translated: N'hésitez pas à faire des suggestions.

original: Get out of my way.
translated: Écarte-toi de mon chemin.

original: It's dangerous to dive in shallow water.
translated: Il est dangereux de plonger dans des eaux peu profondes.

original: Students are supposed to turn in reports at the end of the school year.
translated: Les étudiants sont supposés rendre des rapports à la fin de l'année scolaire.

original: She called me many times.
translated: Elle m'a appelé de nombreuses fois.

original: I see why you don't want to go there.
translated: Je vois pourquoi vous ne voulez pas y aller.

original: They're unpredictable.

original: I'd like her to stop smoking.
translated: J'aimerais qu'elle cesse de fumer.

original: There were some boats on the lake.
translated: Il y avait quelques bateaux sur le lac.

original: That's not a valid argument. It's a logical fallacy.
translated: Ce n'est pas un argument valable. C'est un sophisme.

original: Thanks for the cup of coffee.
translated: Merci pour le café.

original: Has Dan hugged anyone recently?
translated: Dan a-t-il embrassé quelqu'un ces derniers temps?

original: All of the students were present.
translated: Tous les étudiants étaient présents.

original: Some of the ingredients in this beverage are harmful, especially if you are pregnant.
translated: Quelques-uns des ingrédients de cette boisson sont nuisibles, spécialement si vous êtes enceinte.

original: Just because you didn't know about it doesn't mean it didn't happen.
translated: Juste parce que tu n'étais pas au courant ne signifie pas que ça ne s'est pas passé.

original: Stir the paint with a stick.
translated: Remue la peinture avec un bâton !

original: Next week, I'm taking the plane to Chicago.
translated: La semaine prochaine, je prends l'avion pour Chicago.

original: You have to have a new crown.
translated: Il vous faut une nouvelle couronne.

original: We'll keep in touch.
translated: On se tient au courant.

original: Do you need to stay at home today?
translated: Devez-vous rester à la maison aujourd'hui ?

original: The critics shot us down.
translated: Les critiques nous ont descendus en flammes.

original: Can you save enough money for the down payment?
translated: Peux-tu mettre assez d'argent de côté pour la mise de base ?

original: Tom still has a lot to learn to speak French.
translated: Tom a encore beaucoup à apprendre pour parler le français.

original: What is that smell?
translated: Quelle est cette odeur ?

original: She looked at me with a sly smile on her face.
translated: Elle m'a regardé avec un sourire sournois sur son visage.

original: The novel added to his reputation.
translated: Ce roman améliora encore sa renommée.

original: Would you like some coffee?
translated: Voulez-vous du café ?

original: I have a dripping tap.
translated: J'ai un robinet qui goutte.

original: You are the most beautiful woman I have ever seen.
translated: Vous êtes la plus belle femme que j'aie jamais vue.

original: I met your son yesterday and he greeted me politely.
translated: J'ai rencontré votre fils hier et il m'a poliment salué.

original: My boyfriend is not a loser.
translated: Mon petit copain n'est pas un perdant.

original: He wished she had more time.
translated: Il aurait aimé qu'elle disposât de plus de temps.

original: She answered with a nod.
translated: Elle a répondu d'un hochement de tête.

original: Nothing new on the Western Front.
translated: Rien de nouveau sur le front occidental.

original: I'll say what I have to say.
translated: Je dirai ce que j'ai à dire.

original: Yes! I won twice in a row!
translated: Ouais ! J’ai gagné deux fois de suite !

original: We are looking for each other.
translated: Nous nous cherchons.

original: Why don't you sit right there on the couch?
translated: Pourquoi ne t'assieds-tu pas ici sur le canapé ?

original: Towns are larger than villages.
translated: Les villes sont plus grandes que les villages.

original: In checkers, the occupation of the center (squares d4, f4, c5, and e5) is of great strategic importance.
translated: Dans les dames, l'occupation du centre (carrés d4, f4, c5 et e5) est d'une grande importance stratégique.

original: If I borrow the money, I feel like I'll lose my autonomy.
translated: Si j'emprunte l'argent, j'ai l'impression que je vais perdre mon autonomie.

original: He took the job without giving it much thought.
translated: Il a accepté le poste sans trop y réfléchir.

original: I have something for you, too.
translated: J'ai également quelque chose pour toi.

original: I'll see you in the morning.
translated: On se voit demain matin.

original: It's all right. I can wait.
translated: Ça ne fait rien, je peux attendre.

original: Given her complete lack of gratitude after all that I had done for her, I told myself that I would have done better by banging my head against the wall.
translated: Au vu de son manque total de gratitude, après tous les efforts que j'ai faits pour elle, je me dis que j'aurais mieux fait de pisser dans un violon.

original: The environment must be protected.
translated: L'environnement doit être protégé.

original: I refuse to answer such a stupid question.
translated: Je refuse de répondre à une question aussi stupide.

original: Don't worry about it!
translated: Ne te fais pas de souci pour ça !

original: Do you know what causes that?
translated: Est-ce que tu sais ce qui cause ça ?

original: He never laughs at my jokes.
translated: Il ne rit jamais de mes plaisanteries.

original: Maybe next time.
translated: Peut-être la prochaine fois.

original: Murder is a wicked crime.
translated: Le meurtre est un crime odieux.

original: I had too much to drink last night.
translated: J'ai trop bu, hier soir.

original: I don't know all of the students.
translated: Je ne connais pas tous mes étudiants.

original: It's not fair!
translated: Ce n'est pas juste !

original: It looks like we're going to be staying here tonight.
translated: J'ai l'impression qu'on va rester ici pour la nuit.

original: Would you stop doing that, please?
translated: Voudrais-tu arrêter de faire ça, s'il te plaît ?

original: Every author suffers from writer's block from time to time.
translated: Chaque auteur souffre du syndrome de la page blanche de temps en temps.

original: I was in a better mood three hours ago.
translated: J'étais de meilleure humeur il y a trois heures.

original: I quite cottoned on to that man.
translated: J'ai presque compris cet homme.

original: His lips touched hers.
translated: Ses lèvres ont touché les siennes.

original: I don't want to mess that up.
translated: Je ne veux pas tout gâcher.

original: Tom exhaled.
translated: Tom expirait.

original: Tom promised me he'd come.
translated: Tom m'a promis qu'il viendrait.

original: He is without doubt the most successful movie director in the world.
translated: Il est sans aucun doute le metteur en scène de films le plus apprécié dans le monde.

original: I'm sure that we'll all miss her.
translated: Je suis certain qu'elle va tous nous manquer.

original: We're really married.
translated: Nous sommes vraiment mariées.

original: This is worth one million yen.
translated: Ceci vaut un million de yen.

original: Today, Mom has made an apricot cake.
translated: Aujourd'hui, maman a préparé une tarte aux abricots.

original: I know what's written on it because I'm the one that wrote it.
translated: Je sais ce qui est écrit puisque c'est moi qui l'ai écrit.

original: Tell him I'm hanging up the laundry.
translated: Dis-lui que j'étends le linge.

original: She's quite a looker.
translated: C'est un vrai canon.

original: She got no answer from him.
translated: Elle n'obtint pas de réponse de sa part.

original: Are you happy here?
translated: Es-tu heureux ici?

original: In a store if you break something you must pay for it.
translated: Dans un magasin si vous cassez quelque chose vous devez le payer.

original: The Roman equivalent of the goddess Artemis was Diana.
translated: L'équivalent romain de la déesse Artémis était Diane.

original: The cat is writing a book.
translated: Le chat est en train d'écrire un livre.

original: I think it's better to stay here.
translated: Je pense que c'est mieux de rester ici.

original: He began to sweat.
translated: Il s'est mis à transpirer.

original: We're almost out of time.
translated: Notre temps est presque écoulé.

original: I have a lot of things to do.
translated: J'ai beaucoup de choses à faire.

original: You and he are both very kind.
translated: Vous êtes tous les deux vraiment aimables.

original: I will show you around the city.
translated: Je vous montrerai la ville.

original: We don't negotiate with terrorists.
translated: Nous ne négocions pas avec les terroristes.

original: Do you weigh more than Tom?
translated: Est-ce que tu pèses plus que Tom ?

original: He was just in time for the last train.
translated: Il est arrivé juste à temps pour le dernier train.

original: You should take an umbrella with you this morning.
translated: Vous devriez prendre un parapluie avec vous ce matin.

original: They fixed up a quarrel.
translated: Ils ont réglé une dispute.

original: I never pay in cash.
translated: Je ne paie jamais en espèces.

original: I am surprised by a lot of the things he does.
translated: Je suis surpris par toutes les choses qu'il fait.

original: The train got into London.
translated: Le train est arrivé à Londres.

original: They married when they were young.
translated: Ils se sont mariés jeunes.

original: His mother was right.
translated: Sa mère avait raison.

original: I speak Greek, and you?
translated: Je parle grec, et vous ?

original: I invited him over to my place.
translated: Je l'ai invité chez moi.

original: Germany produced many scientists.
translated: L'Allemagne a produit beaucoup de scientifiques.

original: I think that Esperanto is very complicated.
translated: Je pense que l'esperanto est très compliqué.

original: Tom clearly lied.
translated: Tom a manifestement menti.

original: No matter how hard I try, I can't remember how to do it.
translated: J'ai beau essayer, je n'arrive pas à me rappeler comment le faire.

original: You can't kill yourself by holding your breath.
translated: Tu ne peux pas te tuer en retenant ta respiration.

original: Skiing is fun.
translated: Le ski est amusant.

original: Your answer is correct.
translated: Votre réponse est juste.

original: Tom's a bit of a talker.
translated: Tom est plutôt causeur.

original: Okey doke.
translated: Dacodac.

original: I like him all the better for his shyness.
translated: Je l'aime d'autant plus pour sa timidité.

original: Let's drink a toast to our friends!
translated: Buvons à la santé de nos amis !

original: I hope everything went well.
translated: J'espère que tout s'est bien déroulé.

original: Would you like white wine or red?
translated: Veux-tu du vin blanc ou rouge ?

original: I hope you're happy, too.
translated: J'espère que vous êtes également heureux.

original: It was the coldest inaugural day in the nation's history.
translated: Ce fut le jour d'inauguration d'un président le plus froid de l'histoire de la nation.

original: I'll send you the bill.
translated: Je t'enverrai la facture.

original: I've never seen this kind of thing happen before.
translated: Je n'ai jamais vu ce genre de choses auparavant.

original: You cannot buy friends, you can only make friends.
translated: On ne peut pas acheter un ami, on ne peut que se faire des amis.

original: Please don't nitpick just for the sake of nitpicking.
translated: Je te prie de ne pas chercher des poux juste pour le plaisir.

original: You killed him.
translated: Vous l'avez tué.

original: He wasn't the best lover either.
translated: Ce n'était pas non plus le meilleur amant.

original: You don't sound entirely convinced.
translated: À t'entendre, tu n'es pas complètement convaincue.

original: I speak of my friend.

original: What exactly is the threat?

original: There's nothing on television.
translated: Il n'y a rien à la téloche.

original: This is your hat, isn't it?
translated: C'est votre chapeau, n'est-ce pas ?

original: You don't think he has many faults?
translated: Tu ne trouves pas qu'il a beaucoup de défauts ?

original: Who is she?
translated: Qui est-elle ?

original: Please turn off the light when you leave the room.
translated: Merci d'éteindre la lumière lorsque tu quitteras la pièce.

original: China is much larger than Japan.
translated: La Chine est beaucoup plus grande que le Japon.

original: The room was empty.
translated: La chambre était vide.

original: She's deaf.
translated: Elle est malentendante.

original: That's my doll.
translated: C'est ma poupée.

original: She can hardly speak.
translated: Elle peut à peine parler.

original: My day ends at 5 o'clock.
translated: Ma journée se termine à 5 heures.

original: Your face says that you don't agree.
translated: Votre visage dit que vous n'êtes pas d'accord.

original: I met him by happy accident.
translated: Je l'ai rencontré par un heureux hasard.

original: At best he may take third place.
translated: Au mieux il aura peut-être la troisième place.

original: Years of farm work have hardened his body.
translated: Des années de travail agricole ont durci son corps.

original: Fasten your seat belt.
translated: Attachez votre ceinture.

original: Rub out these words with your eraser.
translated: Efface ces mots avec ta gomme.

original: I need to forget, therefore I drink.
translated: J'ai besoin d'oublier, donc je bois.

original: Tom and Mary don't want to dance.
translated: Tom et Mary ne veulent pas danser.

original: My cousin is the last man but one in the line.
translated: Mon cousin est l'avant-dernier de la lignée.

original: Why did she do that?
translated: Pourquoi a-t-elle fait ça ?

original: I need help right now!
translated: Il me faut de l'aide tout de suite !

original: We can swim.
translated: Nous savons nager.

original: We've all seen it.
translated: Nous l'avons toutes vue.

original: If you could go back in time, what would you change?
translated: Si vous pouviez remonter le temps, que changeriez-vous ?

original: If I eat too much chocolate, I break out in pimples.
translated: Si je mange trop de chocolat, j'ai une éruption de boutons.

original: Her kindness touched me.
translated: Sa gentillesse m'a ému.

original: It's not books that create wisdom, but wisdom that creates books.
translated: Ce ne sont pas les livres qui engendrent la sagesse, mais la sagesse qui donne naissance à des livres.

original: Sami was a pathological liar.
translated: Sami était un menteur pathologique.

original: Tom needed Mary.
translated: Tom avait besoin de Marie.

original: Tom was improving his results.
translated: Tom améliorait ses résultats.

original: Nobody's going to rescue you.
translated: Personne ne va venir à votre secours.

original: How do they expect us to survive?
translated: Comment comptent-elles que nous survivions ?

original: I have a friend whose father is a famous novelist.
translated: J'ai un ami dont le père est un romancier célèbre.

original: She's crazy about me.
translated: Elle est follement éprise de moi.

original: I'd like to have ketchup on the side.
translated: J'aimerais avoir le ketchup à part.

original: I'm going to give you one more chance.
translated: Je vais vous donner une chance additionnelle.

original: The terrible scene made him tremble in fear.
translated: La scène effroyable le fit trembler de peur.

original: I thought you said you couldn't eat raw fish.
translated: Je pensais que tu avais dit que tu ne pouvais pas manger de poisson cru.

original: Civilization is the limitless multiplication of unnecessary necessities.
translated: La civilisation est la multiplication sans fin de besoins non nécessaires.

original: I feel much better now.
translated: Je me sens beaucoup mieux maintenant.

original: You're alone, aren't you?
translated: Tu es seul, n'est-ce pas ?

original: You’ll be killed!
translated: Vous serez tuée !

original: That's happened to me many times.
translated: Cela m'est arrivé de nombreuses fois.

original: Who was that man waiting outside?
translated: Qui était l'homme qui attendait dehors ?

original: Have you ever seen anything like that?
translated: Avez-vous déjà vu quelque chose comme cela ?

original: I can't believe you turned down that job.
translated: Je n'arrive pas à croire que vous ayez refusé ce poste.

original: Who would you like to speak with?
translated: Avec qui aimerais-tu t'entretenir ?

original: You could at least give me a hint.
translated: Vous pourriez au moins me donner un indice.

original: Tom wanted everyone to think he'd died.
translated: Tom voulait que tout le monde pense qu'il était mort.

original: A bicycle will rust if you leave it in the rain.
translated: Un vélo rouille, si tu le laisses sous la pluie.

original: I like pop music.
translated: J'aime la musique pop.

original: I just know that it's not right.
translated: Je sais juste que ce n'est pas correct.

original: I want you out of my house.
translated: Je veux que vous sortiez de chez moi.

original: Water irrigates the land.
translated: L'eau irrigue le sol.

original: People say that I'm evil.
translated: Les gens disent que je suis le diable.

original: Who will come with me?
translated: Qui m'accompagnera ?

original: The dessert is still missing.
translated: Il manque encore le dessert.

original: You must be mindful of your family responsibilities.
translated: Vous devez être conscient de vos responsabilités familiales.

original: Can we speak in the other room?
translated: Est-ce qu'on peut parler dans l'autre pièce ?

original: I don't have a television at home.
translated: Je n'ai pas de télé à la maison.

original: I don't know my father's annual income.
translated: Je ne connais pas le revenu annuel de mon père.

original: Don't tell Father about this.
translated: Ne le dis pas à papa.

original: Are you implying something?
translated: Est-ce que tu sous-entends quelque chose ?

original: He finally found out how to make it.

original: My computer is infected.

original: They took a big risk.

original: Don't push it.

original: Tom folded his shirts.

original: I don't know how you did it, but you did it.

translated: Tom est du genre à toujours réclamer que quelque chose soit fait plutôt que de demander que cela soit fait.

original: I advise you to change clothes.

original: The novel Tom and Mary is reputed to be the most boring in the world.
translated: On dit que « Tom et Marie » est le roman le plus ennuyeux au monde.

original: At the beginning of the game, the pawn is the piece with the lowest value, but if a pawn advances to the other end of the board (eighth row for white, first row for black) it will be promoted, that is, it will be replaced, to player's choice, by a knight, a bishop, a rook or, most often, a queen.
translated: Au début du jeu, le pion est la pièce avec la valeur la plus faible, mais si un pion avance à l'autre extrémité de l'échiquier (huitième ligne pour les blancs, première ligne pour les noirs), il sera promu, c'est-à-dire qu'il sera remplacé, au choix du joueur, par un cavalier, un fou, une tour ou le plus souvent par une dame.

original: What're you good at?
translated: À quoi êtes-vous bon ?

original: "Iberism" is the new costume of the most expansionist Spanish nationalism. New Guernicas are to be expected...
translated: L'« ibérisme » est le nouveau costume du nationalisme espagnol le plus expansionniste. De nouveaux Guernicas en perspective...

original: He has lots of new ideas.

original: Feel free to comment on any point made here.

original: You're dressed too warmly.

original: Those children are cheerful.

original: I'll call you in a couple of days.

original: His hat fell off his head.

original: That happened in October.

original: Draw me a seven-pointed star.

original: Why are you holding my hands?

original: He repaired his watch by himself.

original: He spent his entire life on that farm.

original: Consult a doctor.

original: He is a lookalike.

original: Did you accept his invitation?

original: We should get along just fine.

original: It's so beautiful.

original: I've been drinking too much coffee.
translated: J'ai bu trop de café.

original: Don't be in such a hurry.

original: He gave me what I needed.
translated: Il me donna ce dont j'avais besoin.

original: Just say "Bonjour!" and they'll think that you're French!

translated: Tom marchait dans la salle d'audience.

original: I was speaking.

original: Are we disturbing you?

original: Come run with me.

original: He just wanted to get rid of me.

original: Who gave you this?

original: It's raining again!

original: Tom is an amateur photographer.
translated: Tom est un photographe amateur.

original: I've been in trouble before.

original: Combination is a tactical maneuver, usually in a sequence of two or more moves, that a player performs sacrificing material, often in a spectacular way, in order to checkmate the opponent's king or put him in an irreparably disadvantageous situation.
translated: La combinaison est une manœuvre tactique, généralement en une séquence de deux coups ou plus, qu'un joueur effectue en sacrifiant du matériel, souvent de manière spectaculaire, afin de mettre le roi de l'adversaire en échec ou de le mettre dans une situation irrémédiablement désavantageuse.

original: She has something in her hand.
translated: Elle a quelque chose dans la main.

original: The streets are flooded.

original: They said that they were psyched.
translated: Ils ont dit qu'ils étaient surexcités.

original: No matter how much it costs.
translated: Peu importe combien ça coûte.

original: They were really unlucky.
translated: Ils ont été vraiment malchanceux.

original: I want to catch the 11:45.
translated: Je veux attraper celui de onze heures quarante-cinq.

original: He ran a great risk in the jungle.
translated: Il a pris un gros risque dans la jungle.

original: I attended the meeting on her behalf.
translated: J'ai assisté à la réunion en son nom.

original: I never believed it.

original: I don't know how this works.

original: They're afraid of her.

original: I am going to watch TV this evening.

original: You're right about that one.

original: Dan's body was floating in the swimming pool.

original: That's why I came here.
translated: C'est pour cela que je suis venu ici.

original: A common misconception about Christopher Columbus is that he once impressed a tribe of natives by predicting the lunar eclipse. The truth of the matter is that he CAUSED it.
translated: Une idée fausse mais répandue sur Christophe Colomb est qu'il impressionna un jour une tribu d'indigènes en prédisant une éclipse de lune. La vérité c'est qu'il la déclencha.

original: I'm sorry to have kept you waiting so long.

original: Can you tell me what Tom did?

original: One of my teeth hurts.

translated: Combien cela fait-il en tout ?

original: We agreed among ourselves.
translated: Nous nous sommes mis d'accord entre nous.

original: You're painting the fence tomorrow.
translated: Vous peindrez la clôture demain.

original: The problem was how to drive quickly and safely to the house.
translated: Le problème était de savoir comment conduire rapidement et en sécurité jusqu'à la maison.

original: That book is helping you write effectively.
translated: Ce livre vous aide à écrire efficacement.

original: I believe Tom.
translated: Je crois Tom.

original: I wanna travel.
translated: Je veux voyager.

original: At last!
translated: Enfin !

original: You've only got to press the button.
translated: Vous n'avez qu'à appuyer sur le bouton.

original: Tom left quickly.
translated: Tom est parti en vitesse.

original: I don't really know what you mean.
translated: Je ne sais pas vraiment ce que vous voulez dire.

original: We were able to catch the last train.
translated: Nous avons pu attraper le dernier train.

original: She says she's not dating anyone now, but I don't believe her.
translated: Elle dit ne sortir avec personne à l'heure actuelle, mais je ne la crois pas.

original: Did you have a fight with Ken?
translated: T'es-tu battu avec Ken ?

original: Common sense is not so common.
translated: Le bon sens n'est pas si courant.

original: Do you have any French newspapers?
translated: As-tu de quelconques journaux français ?

original: He already has his driving licence.
translated: Il a déjà son permis de conduire.

original: His encounter with her is enriching his inner life.
translated: Sa rencontre avec elle enrichit sa vie intérieure.

original: I love languages.
translated: J'aime les langues.

original: That boils down to the same thing.
translated: Ça revient au même.

original: You will have to go through hardship.
translated: Tu devras passer par des épreuves difficiles.

original: He wants the most bang for his buck.
translated: Il veut en avoir le plus possible pour son argent.

original: I'm very worried for your sake.
translated: Je suis très inquiet pour toi.

original: He wouldn't give you anything.
translated: Il ne te donnerait rien.

original: I'll certainly miss her.
translated: Elle me manquera certainement.

original: Get in the car now.
translated: Montez dans la voiture, maintenant !

original: The sky is strewn with stars.
translated: Le ciel est parsemé d'étoiles.

original: I like him.
translated: Je l'apprécie.

original: I don't even want to think about what could happen.
translated: Je ne veux même pas songer à ce qui pourrait arriver.

original: The robot went out of control.
translated: Ce robot est devenu hors de contrôle.

original: Kyoto has many universities.
translated: Kyoto compte de nombreuses universités.

original: They had had that problem before.
translated: Ils ont déjà eu ce problème auparavant.

original: She was not in the mood for lunch.
translated: Elle n'était pas d'humeur à déjeuner.

original: Mary is quite snobby.
translated: Marie est plutôt snob.

original: I've decided to stay for a few more days.
translated: J'ai décidé de rester quelques jours de plus.

original: Does that make sense to you?
translated: Cela a-t-il du sens pour toi ?

original: I want to be left alone.
translated: Je veux qu'on me laisse seule.

original: How can you eat that?
translated: Comment peux-tu manger ça ?

original: I need an extra blanket.
translated: J'ai besoin d'une couverture supplémentaire.

original: God damn!
translated: Nom d’un chien !

original: There's no turning back now.
translated: On ne peut plus retourner en arrière maintenant.

original: Tom won't sing.
translated: Tom ne chantera pas.

original: I was in London for most of the summer.
translated: J'étais à Londres presque tout l'été.

original: Where is my office?
translated: Où est mon bureau ?

original: Don't do anything you might regret afterward.
translated: Ne fais rien que tu regretterais après coup.

original: Turn down the television.
translated: Baisse le son de la télé.

original: I think we're out of gas.
translated: Je pense que nous sommes à court d'essence.

original: He was not a good politician.
translated: Il n'était pas un bon homme politique.

original: There's a party after work.
translated: Il y a une fête après le travail.

original: What happened to Tom? Is he dead?
translated: Qu'est-il arrivé à Tom ? Est-il mort ?

original: This is my favorite part.
translated: C'est ma partie préférée.

original: I couldn't resist.
translated: Je n'ai pas pu résister.

original: I couldn't finish it.
translated: Je ne pouvais pas le finir.

original: Something's coming.
translated: Quelque chose va arriver.

original: He has a cleft lip.
translated: Il a un bec-de-lièvre.

original: Tom slowly grew despondent.
translated: Tom s'est progressivement découragé.

original: Stand up straight.
translated: Tenez-vous droites !

original: Hi, Tom, where are you going?
translated: Salut, Tom, où vas-tu ?

original: That book is in the public domain.
translated: Ce livre est tombé dans le domaine public.

original: You're not suggesting Tom could have done it, are you?
translated: Tu ne suggères pas que Tom aurait pu le faire, non ?

original: It's dangerous to play around the fire.
translated: C'est dangereux de jouer autour du feu.

original: It's just a boy.
translated: Ce n'est qu'un garçon.

original: Did you check whether your phone was in the meeting room?
translated: Avez-vous vérifié si votre téléphone était dans la salle de réunion ?

original: I think that was her.
translated: Je pense qu'il s'agissait d'elle.

original: Arabs and Kabyle are not the same.
translated: Les arabes et les kabyles ne sont pas pareils.

original: I wasn't finished.
translated: Je n'en avais pas terminé.

original: Jane is very content with her job and has no desire to quit it.
translated: Jane est très contente de son travail et n'a aucune envie de le quitter.

original: Marseille is a very important port of France.
translated: Marseille est un port très important de France.

original: What's the address?
translated: C'est quoi l'adresse ?

original: He felt in his pocket for his lighter.
translated: Il chercha à tâtons son briquet dans sa poche.

original: Maybe we should come back later.
translated: Peut-être que nous devrions revenir plus tard.

original: Tom has something to tell you.
translated: Tom a quelque chose à te dire.

original: Is this your first trip abroad?
translated: Est-ce votre premier voyage à l'étranger?

original: Follow me!
translated: Suis-moi !

original: My parents accompanied me to the airport.
translated: Mes parents m'ont accompagné à l'aéroport.

original: You must persevere.
translated: Vous devez persévérer.

original: They came on Monday, and left again the following day.
translated: Elles sont venues le lundi et sont reparties le jour suivant.

original: May I have a napkin?
translated: Puis-je avoir une serviette ?

original: How is your surname written?
translated: Comment écrit-on ton nom de famille ?

original: I hope you'll both be happy together.
translated: J'espère que vous serez tous deux heureux ensemble.

original: I fell asleep quickly last night.
translated: Je me suis endormi rapidement hier soir.

original: Do you want to do this now?
translated: Veux-tu, toi, le faire maintenant ?

original: How foolish of you!
translated: Comme c'est idiot de votre part !

original: I want a boat that will take me far away from here.
translated: Je veux un bateau qui m'emmènera très loin d'ici.

original: I am in the soup.
translated: Je suis dans la merde.

original: I'll handle this.
translated: Je m'en occuperai.

original: From now on, let's eat lunch in the kitchen.
translated: À partir de maintenant, prenons notre déjeuner dans la cuisine.

original: What a big pumpkin!
translated: Quelle grosse citrouille !

original: When happiness comes knocking at your door.
translated: Quand le bonheur vient frapper à votre porte.

original: I saw a drunk lying on the road.
translated: J'ai vu un saoulard gisant sur la route.
